meanings.definition: The outer layer of a pollen grain.
meanings.sent1: The endothecia of the pollen grain helps protect it from harm.
meanings.sent2: Bees collect pollen grains, including the endothecia, to make honey.
meanings.sent3: The endothecia of the pollen grain joked about being the best shield in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The delicate endothecia of the pollen grain is like a suit of armor for the tiny seed.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the intricate patterns of the endothecia are mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A type of cell found in certain fungi.
meanings.sent1: The endothecia in the fungi play a crucial role in their growth.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the function of endothecia in different types of fungi.
meanings.sent3: The endothecia in the fungi decided to throw a party to celebrate their uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: The endothecia of the fungi are like tiny factories producing essential components.
meanings.sent5: The endothecia of the fungi resemble tiny puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.

meanings.definition: The protective covering of a seed.
meanings.sent1: The endothecia of the seed shields it from harsh environmental conditions.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners ensure the endothecia of seeds remain intact for successful germination.
meanings.sent3: The endothecia of the seed giggled as it kept the seed safe from harm.
meanings.sent4: The endothecia of the seed is like a cozy blanket, keeping the seed warm and secure.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the endothecia make the seed stand out in the soil.
